definition: to bring together/to mediate/to arrange a deal
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: She added that having conversations with friends wasn't helpful at all.
sentences.chinese: 她增補說合伴侶會話底子沒用。

sentences.english: I say collaboration because all of you are in it with Me.
sentences.chinese: 我說合作是因爲你們每個人都要和我一起參與其中。

sentences.english: Talks between the two sides, brokered by the U. S. ambassador, have reached a stalemate.
sentences.chinese: 由美國大使說合的雙方談判陷入僵。

sentences.english: Their parents have tried for years to pair the 2 young people off.
sentences.chinese: 幾年來雙方的父母一直想說合這兩位年輕人結成一對。

sentences.english: Mister Venter says Synthia is a new species.
sentences.chinese: 文特爾先生說合成體是一個新的物種。

sentences.english: It was the first time Xichunyiming had visited Hefei. He said Hefei had left a good impression on him.
sentences.chinese: 西村義明首次來肥，他說合肥給他留下了很好的印象。

sentences.english: His visit in Hefei, the first ever, gave him left him a very good impression, Xichunyiming said.
sentences.chinese: 西村義明首次來肥，他說合肥給他留下了很好的印象。

sentences.english: Did you say chorus and flanger?
sentences.chinese: 你是說合唱和弗蘭格效果兼有嗎？
